title: (x) "Foproin" strange serif face - Bernhard Modern {Rainer}
content:
Font received in a low resolution GIF.

Anyone knows it’s name.

Thanks,

eñe

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [tipo\_muestra.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023161658/http:/typophile.com/files/tipo_muestra.gif) | 7.77 KB |

 [‹ (x) Star Wars original movie poster credits - ITC Serif Gothic {Mark S}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023161658/http:/typophile.com/node/20498 "Go to previous forum topic") [serif text face from the Book of Mormon ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023161658/http:/typophile.com/node/20488 "Go to next forum topic")
author: eÑe

comments.content:
Looks like one of the [bernhard Modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023161658/http:/www.fontshop.at/fontdetailc.php3?ns=&sns=&co=&co2=&id=fp-C7061-g0102)

EDIT: Bah, I don’t like those redirect country-localisations. Can’t anyone do anything against it?

Fast and precise!!  
Many Thanks

eÑe  
BTW, I dont’t like the redirects either :-)
You are welcome eÑe! Have a nice day.

I’m very sorry, Renko. I feel your redirect pain. The only way to prevent such things for our German and Austrian customers would be to convince those local FontShops to join our website at FontShop.com.

Well, thanks for the answer, Stephen. But I think the shops will stay with the redirecting-tool because of the better comfort for customers when they want to buy a font (at the right, local, shop). It makes sense, for sure, but it is some times annoying for linking to a typeface. And, yes, sometimes it works with the “double-click-trick” to fool the redirect-tool.  
Have a nice day, too.
